channel.title: File permisions
channel.description:
Well, in order to understand the Linux shell I'm browsing through this site: http://linuxcommand.org I came to the page about file permisions (http://linuxcommand.org/lts0070.php) They have the following image:
[img]http://linuxcommand.org/images/permissions_diagram.gif[/img]
But it's not correct, is it?
If I'm right it should be this:
Following the comments: -rwxrwxrwx Following the image: Its a file, read write and execute permissions for the owner, read and write permissions for the group owning the file and read permissions for anyone else.
Am I right or not? Explain if I'm wrong please.

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I get where you are coming from, but I didn’t see it that way at first.

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Oh I get it. IMO they should’ve made it a bit different.

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

no, it just states that those are the r,w and x fields for that specific group.

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Yes, that’s what I said. But the text on the image (on the right) says that it’s 777.

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The image doesn’t say that it represents 777, in fact the image just teaches you what parts mean what. Right?

In the image, it is a file which has read write and execute permissions for the owner, read and write for the group, and only read for the others.

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

The image says it’s -rwxrw-r-- So it’s rwx for the owner, rw for the group owning the file and r for all other users. The comments on the image say it’s the same for everyone (777) But a file with 777 would be -rwxrwxrwx right?

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

The image is correct, what do you think is wrong about it?

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

A dash means that your not allowed to right?

777 is rwxrwxrwx, which gives all users read write and execute permissions. If you follow the image itself it would be 764, and if you follow the description on the image it would be 777.

So in my eyes the image is wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

The picture was correct, you didn’t say that it allows execute permissions for group and public.

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

That’s not my question. I asked if the image is correct or I am correct.

Read full topic

item.title: File permisions
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Or, you could be cool and just do 777.

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Well, in order to understand the Linux shell I’m browsing through this site: http://linuxcommand.org I came to the page about file permisions (http://linuxcommand.org/lts0070.php) They have the following image:

But it’s not correct, is it?

If I’m right it should be this:

Following the comments: -rwxrwxrwx
Following the image: Its a file, read write and execute permissions for the owner, read and write permissions for the group owning the file and read permissions for anyone else.

Am I right or not? Explain if I’m wrong please.
